rdfs:comment: This schema was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.

columns.name: DsgntParticipant
columns.dc:description: The code identifying the Participant that is acting as Designated Participant for the market center, broker, or dealer, as follows: A - AMEX Z - BATS Y - BYX B - BSE W - CBOE M - CHX C - CSE J - EDGA K - EDGX I - ISE Q - NASDAQ T - FINRA N - NYSE P - ARCA X - PHLX V - IEX  L - LTSE H - MIAX U - MEMX.

columns.name: RprtEntityCd
titles: Market Center, Broker, or Dealer Code
columns.dc:description: The code identifying the market center, broker, or dealer, as assigned by a Designated Participant

columns.name: RptDate
columns.dc:description: Six-digit code YYYYMM identifying the calendar month of trading for the market center, broker's or dealer's report contained in the table

columns.name: Sp500
columns.dc:description: Y: NMS stocks that are included in the S&P 500 Index as of the first day of that month; N: other NMS stocks

columns.name: OrderSize
columns.dc:description: 0: less than $250; 250: $250 to less than $1,000, 1000: $1,000 to less than $5,000; 5000: $5,000 to less than $10,000, 10000: $10,000 to less than $20,000; 20000: $20,000 to less than $50,000; 50000: $50,000 to less than $200,000; 200000: $200,000 or more; 199999: all order sizes combined, excluding orders with a notional value of $200,000 or more

columns.name: OrderType
columns.dc:description: M: market orders; ML: marketable limit orders. Exclude other order types, e.g. IOC, FOK.

columns.name: AvgOrderQty
columns.dc:description: (i) The average order size in shares

columns.name: ExctdOrderMidPtAvg
columns.dc:description: (iii) For executions of covered orders, the average midpoint

columns.name: PctExctdAtQuotOrBetter
titles: % Shares Executed at Quote or Better
columns.dc:description: (iv) For executions of covered orders, the percentage of shares executed at the quote or better

columns.name: PctExctdPI
columns.dc:description: (v) For executions of covered orders, the percentage of shares that received price improvement

columns.name: WghtdAvgPctPI
columns.dc:description: (vi) For executions of covered orders, the share-weighted average percentage price improvement, calculated as the cumulative amount that prices were improved less the cumulative amount that prices were executed outside the quote divided by sum of the average midpoint times the number of shares executed

columns.name: AvgEffctvSprdPct
columns.dc:description: (vii) For executions of covered orders, the average percentage effective spread (-1.0 to 1.0)

columns.name: AvgPctQuotSprd
columns.dc:description: (viii) For executions of covered orders, the average percentage quoted spread, calculated as the average quoted spread divided by the average midpoint for such orders (-1.0 to 1.0)

columns.name: AvgEFQPct
columns.dc:description: (ix) For executions of covered orders, the average effective spread divided by the average quoted spread, expressed as a percentage

columns.name: AvgRealSprdPct15sec
columns.dc:description: (x) For executions of covered orders, the average percentage realized spread as calculated 15 seconds after the time of execution

columns.name: AvgRealSprdPct1min
columns.dc:description: (xi) For executions of covered orders, the average percentage realized spread as calculated 1 minute after the time of execution

columns.name: WghtdAvgExctnTime
columns.dc:description: (xii) For executions of covered orders, the share-weighted average execution speed, in milliseconds
